verses.kjv: Now these be the last words of David. David the son of Jesse said, and the man who was raised up on high, the anointed of the God of Jacob, and the sweet psalmist of Israel, said,
verses.web: Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse says, the man who was raised on high says, the anointed of the God of Jacob, the sweet psalmist of Israel:
verses.ct: These are the final words of David — the son of Jesse, the man God raised to greatness, the one anointed by the God of Jacob, and Israel's beloved songwriter:

verses.kjv: The Spirit of the LORD spake by me, and his word was in my tongue.
verses.web: “LORD’s Spirit spoke by me. His word was on my tongue.
verses.ct: "The Spirit of the LORD spoke through me; his word was on my tongue.

verses.kjv: The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spake to me, He that ruleth over men must be just, ruling in the fear of God.
verses.web: The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spoke to me, ‘One who rules over men righteously, who rules in the fear of God,
verses.ct: The God of Israel spoke — the Rock of Israel said to me: 'A ruler over people must be just, governing in the fear of God.

verses.kjv: And he shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, even a morning without clouds; as the tender grass springing out of the earth by clear shining after rain.
verses.web: shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun rises, a morning without clouds, when the tender grass springs out of the earth, through clear shining after rain.’
verses.ct: He will be like the light of morning when the sun rises on a cloudless day, like tender grass sprouting from the earth after rain and sunshine.'

verses.kjv: Although my house be not so with God; yet he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things, and sure: for this is all my salvation, and all my desire, although he make it not to grow.
verses.web: Isn’t my house so with God? Yet he has made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things, and sure, for it is all my salvation, and all my desire, although he doesn’t make it grow.
verses.ct: My family hasn't always measured up to this standard before God. Yet he made an everlasting covenant with me — carefully laid out and guaranteed. This covenant is my whole salvation and everything I long for, even though he hasn't yet brought it all to completion.

verses.kjv: But the sons of Belial shall be all of them as thorns thrust away, because they cannot be taken with hands:
verses.web: But all the ungodly will be as thorns to be thrust away, because they can’t be taken with the hand,
verses.ct: But the wicked will be tossed aside like thorns that no one can pick up with bare hands.

verses.kjv: But the man that shall touch them must be fenced with iron and the staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in the same place.
verses.web: But the man who touches them must be armed with iron and the staff of a spear. They will be utterly burned with fire in their place.”
verses.ct: Anyone who deals with them must come armed with iron and the shaft of a spear. In the end, they'll be completely burned up where they lie."

verses.kjv: These be the names of the mighty men whom David had: The Tachmonite that sat in the seat, chief among the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite: he lift up his spear against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time.
verses.web: These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: Josheb Basshebeth a Tahchemonite, chief of the captains; he was called Adino the Eznite, who killed eight hundred at one time.
verses.ct: Here are the names of David's elite warriors: Josheb-Basshebeth the Tachmonite held the highest rank among the captains. Also called Adino the Eznite, he killed 800 men in a single battle.

verses.kjv: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines that were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel were gone away:
verses.web: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodai the son of an Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines who were there gathered together to battle, and the men of Israel had gone away.
verses.ct: Next was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the 3 mightiest warriors alongside David. He was there when they stood their ground against the Philistines who had gathered for battle, even after the rest of Israel's soldiers had retreated.

verses.kjv: He arose, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand clave unto the sword: and the LORD wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to spoil.
verses.web: He arose and struck the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand froze to the sword; and LORD worked a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to take plunder.
verses.ct: Eleazar stood his ground and cut down Philistines until his hand cramped and locked around his sword. The LORD gave them a tremendous victory that day, and the rest of the army came back only to strip the dead.

verses.kjv: And after him was Shammah the son of Agee the Hararite. And the Philistines were gathered together into a troop, where was a piece of ground full of lentiles: and the people fled from the Philistines.
verses.web: After him was Shammah the son of Agee a Hararite. The Philistines had gathered together into a troop, where there was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the people fled from the Philistines.
verses.ct: After him was Shammah son of Agee the Hararite. The Philistines had massed together at a field full of lentils, and the Israelite troops fled from them.

verses.kjv: But he stood in the midst of the ground, and defended it, and slew the Philistines: and the LORD wrought a great victory.
verses.web: But he stood in the middle of the plot and defended it, and killed the Philistines; and LORD worked a great victory.
verses.ct: But Shammah planted himself in the middle of that field, defended it, and killed the Philistines. The LORD gave them a tremendous victory.

verses.kjv: And three of the thirty chief went down, and came to David in the harvest time unto the cave of Adullam: and the troop of the Philistines pitched in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.web: Three of the thirty chief men went down, and came to David in the harvest time to the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.ct: During harvest time, 3 of the 30 leading warriors went down to David at the cave of Adullam while a Philistine raiding party was camped in the valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: And David was then in an hold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
verses.web: David was then in the stronghold; and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
verses.ct: David was in his stronghold at the time, and a Philistine garrison occupied Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!
verses.web: David longed, and said, “Oh that someone would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
verses.ct: David said longingly, "If only someone could get me a drink of water from the well by the gate of Bethlehem!"

verses.kjv: And the three mighty men brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: nevertheless he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto the LORD.
verses.web: The three mighty men broke through the army of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, and took it and brought it to David; but he would not drink of it, but poured it out to LORD.
verses.ct: So the 3 warriors fought their way through the Philistine army, drew water from the well by Bethlehem's gate, and brought it back to David. But he refused to drink it. Instead, he poured it out as an offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he said, Be it far from me, O LORD, that I should do this: is not this the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mighty men.
verses.web: He said, “Be it far from me, LORD, that I should do this! Isn’t this the blood of the men who risked their lives to go?” Therefore he would not drink it. The three mighty men did these things.
verses.ct: He said, "LORD, I could never drink this! This is like the blood of men who risked their lives to get it." So he wouldn't drink it. These were the kinds of things those 3 mighty warriors did.

verses.kjv: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief among three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred, and slew them, and had the name among three.
verses.web: Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief of the three. He lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them, and had a name among the three.
verses.ct: Abishai, Joab's brother and son of Zeruiah, was the leader of another group of 3. He once raised his spear against 300 men and killed them, earning a reputation among the 3.

verses.kjv: Was he not most honourable of three? therefore he was their captain: howbeit he attained not unto the first three.
verses.web: Wasn’t he most honorable of the three? Therefore he was made their captain. However he wasn’t included as one of the three.
verses.ct: He was the most honored of this group and became their commander, but he didn't rank among the top 3 warriors.

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man, of Kabzeel, who had done many acts, he slew two lionlike men of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow:
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in the middle of a pit in a time of snow.
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a brave warrior from Kabzeel who accomplished many great feats. He struck down 2 of Moab's fiercest champions. He also climbed down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.

verses.kjv: And he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear.
verses.web: He killed a huge Egyptian, and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
verses.ct: He also killed an impressive Egyptian warrior. The Egyptian was armed with a spear, but Benaiah went at him with just a staff, ripped the spear from the Egyptian's hand, and killed him with his own weapon.

verses.kjv: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among three mighty men.
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did these things, and had a name among the three mighty men.
verses.ct: These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and they earned him a reputation among the 3 mighty warriors.

verses.kjv: He was more honourable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.
verses.web: He was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn’t attain to the three. David set him over his guard.
verses.ct: He was more honored than any of the 30, though he didn't rank among the top 3. David put him in charge of his personal bodyguard.

verses.kjv: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
verses.web: Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty: Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
verses.ct: Among the 30 were: Asahel, Joab's brother; Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem;

verses.kjv: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
verses.web: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
verses.ct: Shammah the Harodite; Elika the Harodite;

verses.kjv: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
verses.web: Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
verses.ct: Helez the Paltite; Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa;

verses.kjv: Abiezer the Anethothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
verses.web: Abiezer the Anathothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
verses.ct: Abiezer from Anathoth; Mebunnai the Hushathite;

verses.kjv: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
verses.web: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
verses.ct: Zalmon the Ahohite; Maharai from Netophah;

verses.kjv: Heleb the son of Baanah, a Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai out of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,
verses.web: Heleb the son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,
verses.ct: Heleb son of Baanah from Netophah; Ittai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin;

verses.kjv: Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash,
verses.web: Benaiah a Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash.
verses.ct: Benaiah from Pirathon; Hiddai from the brooks of Gaash;

verses.kjv: Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
verses.web: Abialbon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
verses.ct: Abialbon the Arbathite; Azmaveth from Bahurim;

verses.kjv: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, of the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
verses.web: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
verses.ct: Eliahba from Shaalbon; Jonathan, from the sons of Jashen;

verses.kjv: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Hararite,
verses.web: Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Ararite,
verses.ct: Shammah the Hararite; Ahiam son of Sharar the Hararite;

verses.kjv: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maachathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
verses.web: Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maacathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
verses.ct: Eliphelet son of Ahasbai the Maachathite; Eliam son of Ahithophel from Giloh;

verses.kjv: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
verses.web: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
verses.ct: Hezrai from Carmel; Paarai the Arbite;

verses.kjv: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
verses.web: Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
verses.ct: Igal son of Nathan from Zobah; Bani the Gadite;

verses.kjv: Zelek the Ammonite, Nahari the Beerothite, armourbearer to Joab the son of Zeruiah,
verses.web: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armor bearers to Joab the son of Zeruiah,
verses.ct: Zelek the Ammonite; Nahari from Beeroth, who served as armor bearer to Joab son of Zeruiah;

verses.kjv: Ira an Ithrite, Gareb an Ithrite,
verses.web: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.ct: Ira the Ithrite; Gareb the Ithrite;

verses.kjv: Uriah the Hittite: thirty and seven in all.
verses.web: and Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in all.
verses.ct: and Uriah the Hittite — 37 in all.
